alert.note: Alert for Lower Lafourche; Lower Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:23PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Terrebonne and central Lafourche Parishes through 300 PM CDT... At 222 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspouts near Chauvin, or 8 miles south of Houma, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houma, Larose, Dulac, Montegut and Chauvin. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
